lead_paragraph: Existing-home sales jumped 14.7 percent from a 19-month low partly cause by new mortgage disclosure rules that slowed contract closings.

headline.main: Home Resales Rallied in December, and Prices Rose as Well

snippet: Existing-home sales jumped 14.7 percent from a 19-month low partly cause by new mortgage disclosure rules that slowed contract closings.
abstract: National Assn of Realtors reports that existing-home sales in December 2015 jumped record 14.7 percent at annual rate of 5.46 million units, partly because new mortgage disclosure rules delayed closings in November.
